title.narrative: SOCIAL POLICY OP 2 CHILD AND GENDER SENSITIVE PLANNING AND BUDGETING

description.narrative: Government has increased capacity to develop and successfully implement inclusive, evidence-based social-economic policies, plans and budgets to benefit children, adolescents and women at the national and local levels., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, children, adolescents, and women, especially the poorest and most vulnerable, benefit from increasingly inclusive, gender- transformative and child-sensitive social policies at the national and sub-national levels

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTION REGIONALE DE L EDUCATION NATIONALE ATSIMO ATSINANANA DREN

sector.narrative: PF4C: Engagement with budget processes to improve social sector budgets (sufficiency, efficiency, effectiveness, transparency, equity)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government has increased capacity to develop and successfully implement inclusive, evidence-based social-economic policies, plansand budgets to benefit children, adolescents and women at the national and local levels.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF completed several analyses to improve the adequacy, efficiency, effectiveness of social sectors budgets – which resulted in good prospects for allocations to the social sectors in the 2022 draft Budget Law.;UNICEF;organized for the Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF), line ministries and CSOs sessions of capacity building, sharing of best practices on budget transparency with International Budget Partnership, UNICEF Zimbabwe, UNICEF Rwanda, and ESARO. UNICEF also organized sessions on budget analysis for line ministries and CSOs when preparing the budget analysis. At year end, UNICEF began to prepare implementation of its local governance for children;programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
